apiClassifier.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic pr-d api-d)
apiClassifier.shortdesc: The MorphShape class represents MorphShape objects on the display list.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The MorphShape class represents MorphShape objects on the display list. You cannot create MorphShape objects directly in ActionScript; they are created when you create a shape tween in the Flash authoring tool.

apiClassifier.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic pr-d api-d)
apiClassifier.shortdesc: The PixelSnapping class is an enumeration of constant values for setting the pixel snapping options by using the pixelSnapping property of a Bitmap object.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The PixelSnapping class is an enumeration of constant values for setting the pixel snapping options by using the pixelSnapping property of a Bitmap object.

apiValue.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic pr-d api-d)
apiValue.shortdesc: A constant value used in the pixelSnapping property of a Bitmap object to specify that the bitmap image is always snapped to the nearest pixel, independent of any transformation.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A constant value used in the pixelSnapping property of a Bitmap object to specify that the bitmap image is always snapped to the nearest pixel, independent of any transformation.

apiValue.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic pr-d api-d)
apiValue.shortdesc: A constant value used in the pixelSnapping property of a Bitmap object to specify that the bitmap image is snapped to the nearest pixel if it is drawn with no rotation or skew and it is drawn at a scale factor of 99.9% to 100.1%.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A constant value used in the pixelSnapping property of a Bitmap object to specify that the bitmap image is snapped to the nearest pixel if it is drawn with no rotation or skew and it is drawn at a scale factor of 99.9% to 100.1%. If these conditions are satisfied, the image is drawn at 100% scale, snapped to the nearest pixel. Internally, this setting allows the image to be drawn as fast as possible by using the vector renderer.

apiValue.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic pr-d api-d)
apiValue.shortdesc: A constant value used in the pixelSnapping property of a Bitmap object to specify that no pixel snapping occurs.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: A constant value used in the pixelSnapping property of a Bitmap object to specify that no pixel snapping occurs.

apiClassifier.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic pr-d api-d)
apiClassifier.shortdesc: Defines the values to use for specifying path-drawing commands.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Defines the values to use for specifying path-drawing commands.
The values in this class are used by the Graphics.drawPath() method, or stored in the commands vector of a GraphicsPath object.

apiValue.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic pr-d api-d)
apiValue.shortdesc: Specifies a drawing command that draws a curve from the current drawing position to the x- and y-coordinates specified in the data vector, using a control point.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Specifies a drawing command that draws a curve from the current drawing position to the x- and y-coordinates specified in the data vector, using a control point. This command produces the same effect as the Graphics.lineTo() method, and uses two points in the data vector control and anchor: (cx, cy, ax, ay ).

apiValue.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic pr-d api-d)
apiValue.shortdesc: Specifies a drawing command that draws a line from the current drawing position to the x- and y-coordinates specified in the data vector.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Specifies a drawing command that draws a line from the current drawing position to the x- and y-coordinates specified in the data vector. This command produces the same effect as the Graphics.lineTo() method, and uses one point in the data vector: (x,y).

apiValue.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic pr-d api-d)
apiValue.shortdesc: Specifies a drawing command that moves the current drawing position to the x- and y-coordinates specified in the data vector.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Specifies a drawing command that moves the current drawing position to the x- and y-coordinates specified in the data vector. This command produces the same effect as the Graphics.moveTo() method, and uses one point in the data vector: (x,y).

apiValue.shortdesc: Represents the default "do nothing" command.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Represents the default "do nothing" command.

apiValue.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic pr-d api-d)
apiValue.shortdesc: Specifies a "line to" drawing command, but uses two sets of coordinates (four values) instead of one set.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Specifies a "line to" drawing command, but uses two sets of coordinates (four values) instead of one set. This command allows you to switch between "line to" and "curve to" commands without changing the number of data values used per command. This command uses two sets in the data vector: one dummy location and one (x,y) location.
The WIDE_LINE_TO and WIDE_MOVE_TO command variants consume the same number of parameters as does the CURVE_TO command.

apiValue.domains: (topic ui-d) (topic hi-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ut-d) (topic pr-d api-d)
apiValue.shortdesc: Specifies a "move to" drawing command, but uses two sets of coordinates (four values) instead of one set.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Specifies a "move to" drawing command, but uses two sets of coordinates (four values) instead of one set. This command allows you to switch between "move to" and "curve to" commands without changing the number of data values used per command. This command uses two sets in the data vector: one dummy location and one (x,y) location.
The WIDE_LINE_TO and WIDE_MOVE_TO command variants consume the same number of parameters as does the CURVE_TO command.
